sen.e: It was named after the waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) made by Kaoru (a character of Genji Monogatari) for Oigimi (oldest daughter of Hachi no miya) at the time of the Buddhist memorial service for the first anniversary of her father's death, that is, 'We knot these braids in trefoil.
